contentrichtext.text: {{Unreferenced|date=August 2009}} [[File:Yama District in Fukushima Prefecture.svg|thumb|Location of Yama District in [[Fukushima Prefecture]]]] {{nihongo|'''Yama'''|耶麻郡|Yama-gun}} is a [[districts of Japan|district]] located in [[Fukushima Prefecture|Fukushima]], [[Japan]]. As of 2008, the district has an estimated [[population]] of 31,175 and a [[population density|density]] of 31.6 persons per km². The total area is 986.763 km². ==Towns and villages== *[[Bandai, Fukushima|Bandai]] *[[Inawashiro, Fukushima|Inawashiro]] *[[Kitashiobara, Fukushima|Kitashiobara]] *[[Nishiaizu, Fukushima|Nishiaizu]] ==Merger== * On January 4, 2006 the towns of [[Shiokawa, Fukushima|Shiokawa]] and [[Yamato, Fukushima|Yamato]], and the villages of [[Atsushiokanō, Fukushima|Atsushiokanō]] and [[Takasato, Fukushima|Takasato]] merged into the city of [[Kitakata, Fukushima|Kitakata]]. {{Fukushima}} {{coord|37.652|N|140.040|E|type:landmark_source:itwiki|display=title}} [[Category:Districts in Fukushima Prefecture]] [[Category:Iwashiro Province|District Yama]] {{Fukushima-geo-stub}}
